dkeep.logic

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArenaMap, DungeonMap, GenericMap

    public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Base class of a game map, if a new map is to be added it must inherit from this class
    Author:
    Joao Almeida , Jose Pedro Machado
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int guards,
           int ogres,
           char[][] map)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        guards - -1 - No Guards , 0 - RandomGuard , 1 - RookieGuard , 2 - DrunkenGuard , 3 - SuspiciousGuard
        ogres - -1 - No Ogres , 0 - Generate [1,5] Ogres , 1 - Generate 1 Ogre, 2 - Generate 2 Ogres ...
        map - Map to use for the specified level

    • Method Detail

      • isFree

        public int isFree(java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> l)
        Checks if the positions passed are free
        Parameters:
        l - Array of positions to check
        Returns:
        -1 if all positions are free, else number that is the position of the array which has the not free pposition Before it checks if the tile is free it checks if the coordinates are valid. A tile is considered free if it is either a ' ', 'S' or a 'k'. Anything else is considered occupied.

      • openDoors

        public void openDoors(boolean keep_closed)
        Opens the doors of the map
        Parameters:
        keep_closed - Whether to keep the doors closed or not If the map has a lever keep_closed should be false, if the map has a key which the hero picks up then keep_closed should be true

      • nextMap

        public abstract Map nextMap(int enemies)
        Returns next map
        Parameters:
        enemies - How many enemies to generate
        Returns:
        Object of the next map class, null if last level

      • pickUpKey

        public boolean pickUpKey()
        Picks up key from map, to be implemented by child classes
        Returns:
        true if hero is supposed to keep the key, or false if it aint (AKA if its a lever)

      • getDoors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> getDoors()
        Gets the map doors (only those openable)
        Returns:
        Array with position of openable doors
